githubOrganizationMetadata.description: An ecosystem for developing, executing, and sharing scientific workflows
githubOrganizationMetadata.readme_content:
## Hi there üëã

üßô Remember, you can do mighty things with the power of [Markdown](https://docs.github.com/github/writing-on-github/getting-started-with-writing-and-formatting-on-github/basic-writing-and-formatting-syntax)

AiiDAlab is a web platform that enables computational scientists to package scientific workflows and computational environments into ‚Äúapps‚Äù and to share those apps with their collaborators and peers.

AiiDAlab builds on [AiiDA](https://aiida.net/) as the computational workflow engine, and the [Jupyter environment](https://jupyter.org/) (notebooks, widgets, ‚Ä¶) for writing and sharing apps.

- The [guidance of development](https://github.com/aiidalab/aiidalab/wiki) includes information need to know for **maintaining**, **developing** and **releasing** AiiDAlab infrustracture.
- The [guidance for users](https://aiidalab.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) contains documentations for **app users**, **app developers** and **platform deployment**.
- The [widgets base documentation](https://aiidalab-widgets-base.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) contains the documentation (examples and API documentation) of `aiidalab-widgets-base`.

output.organizationTypeJustification: AiiDAlab is a community-driven, collaborative open-source platform encompassing 55 public repositories, multiple community members, and no commercial branding, focused on sharing scientific workflows.
output.description: An ecosystem for developing, executing, and sharing scientific workflows

disciplineJustification: AiiDAlab provides software tools and widgets, aligning with information engineering.
The development of a Jupyter-based app platform involves software and computational system design, aligning with computer engineering.
The orchestration of workflows and scientific processes on cloud platforms aligns with systems science and engineering.
